p.span: Mokena School District 159 is dedicated to creating higher performing schools, heightened expectations, rigorous core curriculum and more academic choices and pathways to Mokena families and students throughout the district. Parents, family members, students, staff and community members can use this site as an online resource for information on each of our schools

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-variant: normal; white-space: normal; text-transform: none; word-spacing: 0px; float: none; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal; text-align: justify; display: inline !important; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 19.5px; text-indent: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px;

font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-variant: normal; white-space: normal; text-transform: none; word-spacing: 0px; float: none; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal; text-align: justify; display: inline !important; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 19.5px; text-indent: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px;

p.span: and other valuable resources. We hope you find this new website as a valuable tool to better communicate with all stakeholders.

table.style: height: 1001px; width: 810px; background-color: #ffffff; border-color: #fe000a; border-width: 3px; border-style: solid;

p.span: Per the Governor's mandated closing of schools, the Mokena School District will not be physically at school until the mandate is lifted. However, on April 6, 2020, the district implemented Remote Learning with a Human Touch Plan. This provides students an opportunity to learn while at home. You can read more about this plan here.

If your family is in need of support so that will enable your child can access and participate in these remote learning opportunities, please contact Dr. Kathleen Wilkey (wilkeyk@mokena159.org) with your request. The District will continue to do our best to provide support if at all possible.

We all look forward to the day that students and employees can once again be physically together at our schools. Until then, please continue to practice appropriate social distancing so that all of us can stay safe and healthy.
We are aware of the complications that this will cause for our families. However, we believe that we have a shared responsibility to ensure the safety and well-being of our community.
We will continue to update you with information as it becomes available. Please read our Frequently Asked Questions here: COVID-19 Break FAQs
